title.narrative: Bangladesh Municipal Water Supply and Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to increase access to improved water supply and sanitation services in selected municipalities, and strengthen the municipalities’ institutional capacities for delivering water and sanitation services.

condition.narrative: A Project Steering Committee (PSC) to be set up at the line ministry within three months of Project effectiveness and to meet atleast twice a year in the first two (2) years of the Project and subsequently as frequently as necessary to review the Project’sprogress.

Before approval of the Water Supply Distribution package, the municipality shall enroll at least 50 percent of the consumers(households and establishments) in the first phase design of the Water Supply Distribution Package.

Before commissioning of the piped water services, the municipality shall enroll at least 75 percent of the consumers (householdsand establishments) in the first phase design of the Water Supply Distribution Package.
Each participating municipality shall have a Water Superintendent (Sub-assistant Engineer) (as provided in the LGD-approvedOrganogram) within six months of Project effectiveness.
Implementation Partnership Agreement (IPA) executed for each participating municipalities by DPHE within three months of Projecteffectiveness.

Municipalities must ensure tariff adjustment that fully cover increased cost of water operations, particularly as a result ofincreases in electricity tariffs or other legitimate cost items that increase the costs of Water Service Providers.
Municipalities shall set up a ring-fenced Water Supply and Sanitation (WSS) department with a separate bank account within threemonths of Project effectiveness.

The Implementing Agency shall carry out annual institutional performance scorecard audits and sample citizens’ surveys in each ofthe participating municipalities within 90 days of completion of the Bangladesh Financial Year and disclose reports within 120 daysof completion of the Financial Year.
The Implementing Agency shall constitute a Project Audit Review Committee (PARC) within six months of Project effectiveness, thatmust meet every six months to review Project's audit reports.

The Implementing Agency shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project and prepare Project reports for the Project. Eachsuch Project Report shall be furnished to the Bank semi-annually and not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of theperiod covered by such report.

The Implementing Agency shall set up the Project Management Unit (PMU) before Project effectiveness, and maintain throughout theProject life, led by a full-time Project Director and all specified staff, to be responsible for the coordination and the overallmanagement, implementation and supervision of the Project.

The Recipient shall have its Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 5.09 (b) of the GeneralConditions. Each audit of the Financial Statements shall cover the period of one fiscal year of the Recipient. The auditedFinancial Statements for each such period shall be furnished to the Association not later than six months after the end of suchperiod.
